Our Christian Duty 

                                                (1868) 2T 65 
     243. When we realize the requirements of God, we shall see that He requires us to be temperate in all things. The end of our creation is to glorify God in our bodies and spirits which are His. How can we do this when we indulge the appetite to the injury of the physical and moral powers? God requires that we present our bodies a living sacrifice. Then the duty is enjoined on us to preserve that body in the very best condition of health, that we may comply with His 
                                                                           156
requirements. "Whether, therefore, ye eat or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God."
